p: The primary wild hosts of YFV are non-human primates in both Africa and the Americas. However, African monkeys are more resistant to the virus and hardly die from the infection. In contrast, new world primates can succumb to the virus, which makes them a good epidemiological marker for epidemiological surveillance [ 4]. In the Americas, species of all genera of NHPs that have been recognized and experimentally infected are sensitive and susceptible to YFV, particularly Alouatta spp., Sapajus spp. and Callithrix spp. [ 3].
